title.narrative: Support to Adolescent Girls Empowerment & Proctect DCD 28348 SLE.IRC.2020.01 Imprest No. 8

description.narrative: The ‘Adolescent Girls Empowerment and Protection Project (AGEPP) Year 2’ project in Sierra Leone, implemented by the International Rescue Committee UK aims to empower girls to be able to make informed choices and decisions whilst giving the parents and extended family unit the tools needed to value and support their daughters in order for them to realise their rights and their full potential. The objectives of the project include adolescent girls and young women have relevant social and emotional skills, according to their development potential and adolescent girls are safe in their communities and receive support when they experience harm. The key activities include information and life skills learning sessions, provision of quality clinical and psychosocial support services to survivors of GBV, income generating activities, advocacy, evidence generation and learning.
